name: Plaza Mayor de Lima
description: The historic heart of Lima, featuring stunning colonial architecture and the Government Palace. A UNESCO World Heritage site that showcases Lima's rich history.

name: Miraflores Boardwalk
description: A scenic clifftop promenade offering breathtaking Pacific Ocean views, perfect for evening walks and paragliding adventures.

name: Larco Museum
description: Home to an impressive collection of pre-Columbian art, showcasing over 5,000 years of Peruvian history in a beautiful 18th-century mansion.

name: Barranco District
description: Lima's bohemian quarter filled with colorful colonial architecture, art galleries, and vibrant nightlife along charming cobblestone streets.

name: Huaca Pucllana
description: An ancient adobe pyramid built by the Lima culture around 500 AD, now a fascinating archaeological site with evening illumination.

name: Kennedy Park
description: A lively central park in Miraflores, famous for its resident cat population and surrounded by cafes, restaurants, and street performers.

name: Magic Water Circuit
description: The world's largest fountain complex with 13 interactive fountains featuring spectacular light and music shows every evening.

name: San Francisco Monastery
description: A baroque masterpiece featuring intricate tile work, colonial religious art, and mysterious underground catacombs housing thousands of remains.
